p: Moreover, as has the current study demonstrated, the bioactivity of such substances should be evaluated in the form of ULV fine droplets as well, rather than be administrated solely through their diet, a practice followed by many researchers including agricultural pests [ [25], [26], [27], [28], [29]], including tephritids such as Ceratitis capitata (Wiedemann) [ 83], Bactrocera oleae [ 84], Bactrocera dorsalis Hendel and Bactrocera cucurbitae Coquillet [ 85], as well as aphids [ 86] and mosquitos [ 87].
